column4: i've got an old dual-socket p3 server w/ 6 scsi drives in a raid 5 and 4gb of ram that's newly freed up.  what should i do with it?
have fun with it,, I have a similar board laying around here   never wanted to hunt down dual sockt1  cpus
what kind of fun?
that's what i'm trying to figure out
i would certainly install linux   ,, play with w hat is possible with the configuration,, which video card?
i thought "o, i'll put ubuntu server on there", but then thought: and then what...
built in video
do you know which built in?
no idea
intel   nvidia ??
intel i'm sure
is it running at the moment?
no
there's no OS
it's got a clean raid5
ah ok,, first thing I w ould do is install ubuntu,, or some flavor  and see what happens in terms of performance,, old hardware compatibility  et c
i've got room on my VM hosts for testing, so this is more of an "f around b/c why not" box
any way to start the ubuntu setup and then SSH into it to finish the setup?
i don't feel like sitting in the server room
understood,, my first thing would be to install ubuntu,, compare its performance on that older hardware,, go from there
turn it into a multimedia center  maybe
